RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JULY 27, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since July 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KUKULKAN drew clear of rivals to his inside and angled in while giving chase, steadied off the inside flank of Impetuous at the three eighths pole and raced boxed in from that point, regained stride approaching the quarter, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and was steadily handled to hold on well. STAR LUCK exchanged contact with Bull Shark leaving the gate then chased outside, rounded the turn in the five path and finished well to take second in later yards. ATTUCK gave chase through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and finished well to take third late yards. BULL SHARK exchanged contact with Star Luck leaving the gate then pressured the early pace, took the nod at the five sixteenths pole and dueled clear toward the quarter, but was met nearing mid-stretch and relented the final sixteenth. WIZARD OF ODDS chased the pace, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. VIDMER'S COURAGE was hustled to contention inside then steadied at the inside flank of Kululkan in the vicinity of the three eighths pole, resumed chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. GAMING JACK was never a factor and rounded the turn in the five path. IMPETUOUS set a pressured early pace while tapering inward then gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, dropped back approaching the quarter and faded at the rail on the turn. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed claims of foul against the rider of Kukulkan for alleged interference in the vicinity of the three eighths pole, lodged by the riders of Vidmer's Courage, Wizard Of Odds and Attuck.

ENTRY.NAME: Attuck
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and TEC Racing (Elliott S Logan)

ENTRY.NAME: Impetuous
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,chased near 3/8,faded rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Bull Shark
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,set pressured pace,clear near 1/4,rail turn,relented

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Claiming Purse 13300. FOR MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ASTRAL RIDE chased inside, took the lead at the rail approaching the quarter pole, raced clear midway on the turn and held well under steady handling. MY SLICK NICK rated the early pace, came under pressure toward the five sixteenths pole, was met toward the quarter and ran evenly in the stretch. ROBBEDINTHEBAHAMAS chased through the backstretch, raced in the three and four paths of the turn and finished evenly to take third late yards. FLASH OF DAY chased the pace, raced off the rail on the turn then outfinished for third late yards. ASHARA chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. HEARNS chased the pace, raced off the rail on the turn and finished evenly. RIP IT chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail then weakened. RIDUNCULOUS chased through the backstretch, drifted on the turn, left the turn outside and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Astral Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,up rail near 1/4,clear mid turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELIEVEINROCKNROLL took the lead nearing the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled through the lane. ROLL DEM BONES chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and finished well. SAAFEN gave chase from well back early on, raced near the rail on the turn then dug in through the final furlong to take third later yards. WARRIOR'S ESTATE ducked in and hit the gate at the break then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path, drifted into the lane and relented in a later duel for third. PRIMETIME JET pressured the early pace, continued close off the rail on the turn then weakened leaving the eighth pole. ROCKET SOUND gave chase, raced in the three path of the turn and showed little in the lane. FIT BUT FAT chased the pace outside, rounded the turn about the five path, was carried wider into the lane then weakened. BOOZYMILKSHAKEBAR was not a factor and raced wide on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Believeinrocknroll
ENTRY.OWNER: Oller John and C and B Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Saafen
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back early,rail turn,dug in lane,up 3rd later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Four Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUTTONED UP took the lead while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, was under a hand ride to draw away at the rail on the far turn, then kept alert in the lane. SPRING THE BEAST stalked off the rail, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and settled for second best. TOP HAT TREASON was shuffled back early then saved ground on the opening turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and came along to take third inside the eighth pole. TWEET THIS rated close to the early pace inside, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, drifted into the lane and flattened stride. MONGOLIAN HERO raced well off the pace in the two and three paths the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. STALKING, stalked the early pace from the three path, gave chase into the backstretch but faded past the five sixteenths pole. MAKE WAY raced well off the pace inside and was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Spring the Beast
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 7/16,rail far turn,no match,settled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Top Hat Treason
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,saved ground,chased 7/16,rail far turn,up 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Buttoned Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,hand urged away rail turn,kept alert lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Maiden Claiming Purse 21200. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, For Each $2,500 To $10,000 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IN GOOD TROUBLE took an immediate lead and rated the pace inside, kept the edge over the challenge of ME DARLIN KATHLEEN leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was pressured into the far turn and drew clear midway through the turn, then kept sharp through the lane. The latter settled just off the pace toward the inside, challenged the winner leaving the seven sixteenths pole and raced close through the backstretch, but dropped back past the quarter and settled for second best. CONCERT HALL was bumped leaving the gate then saved ground well off the pace, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and improved her position off the rail on the far turn. CREDIT COMMITTEE stalked off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole then faded approaching the far turn. SARATOGA CENTS ducked out and made contact with Concert Hall leaving the gate then settled back in the three path on the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole but showed little response. BUTTERMILK GIRLZ was not a factor. PARISIAN SUMMER stalked the early pace from the three path but showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Credit Committee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,faded near far turn

ENTRY.NAME: In Good Trouble
ENTRY.OWNER: Abdala III Albert P and The Mirage Ranch

ENTRY.NAME: Concert Hall
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,saved ground,chased 7/16,improved off rail turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUNALDO gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then dug in leaving the eighth pole and got up the final strides. EL LUCERITO drew clear and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn near the rail, was steadily handled leaving the turn but gave up the lead in the final strides. BORN TO SIN exchanged contact with Don't Get Caughtup leaving the gate then gave chase outside, raced off the rail on the turn and dueled through the stretch for third. ROCKIN CHAIR chased the pace, raced near the rail on the turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. BROAD IMAGINATION chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. TWO ROOM SCHOOL chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, angled to the six path toward the head of the lane and flattened stride. COURT TUDOR hesitated at the break and raced well back while giving chase from the half mile pole, then could only improve his position. DR RENDEZVOUS became fractious in the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, but weakened while losing ground on the turn. DON'T GET CAUGHTUP exchanged contact with Born To Sin leaving the gate and was not a factor. LASTWALKTOFREEDOM gave chase outside and bore out entering the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Broad Imagination
ENTRY.OWNER: Melton Christopher W and Mattingly Leonard

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured clear pace,dug in lane,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Runaldo
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,dug in lane,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).

CLAIM.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: GET OFF MY CLOUD stalked the pace from the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced close two deep into the far turn, took the nod toward the head of the lane and was all out to just last. S S ALASKAN CRUZ settled back off the rail on the first turn then eased out and gave chase into the backstretch, rounded the far turn in the three and four paths, lugged in under right hand urging in later yards and just missed. FELICIAS CASTLE saved ground off the pace on the first turn, bid past the seven sixteenths pole and improved off the rail on the far turn, was shut off late yards, altered course from the heels of S S Alaskan Cruz and finished well. ORANGEBURG rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure nearing the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge at the rail into the far turn, was met midway through the turn and ceded the nod to the winner, continued close through the upper stretch but relented later yards. MACHEN'S RIDGE settled inside on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn off the rail, dug in leaving the turn but lacked room in late stretch. ROCKET J. entered the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. MISTER DEEKS raced with the early pace inside, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole but dropped back toward the three eighths and faded at the rail on the far turn. MADDEYE MOODY rounded the first turn in the six path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened into the far turn. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed, a claim of foul for late stretch interference lodged by the rider of Felicias Castle, against the rider of S S Alaskan Cruz.

ENTRY.NAME: Mister Deeks
ENTRY.COMMENT: with early pace,challenged 7/16,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Orangeburg
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,pressured 5/16,met mid turn,relented later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Felicias Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 7/16,shut off late,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Machen's Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,lacked room late

ENTRY.NAME: S S Alaskan Cruz
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,eased out 1/2,chased,3& 4p,lugged in,just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since November 27 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Co nsidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WITH SECRET ENERGY rounded the first turn in the three path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, eased to the four path into the stretch and dug in to get up the final yards. C R'S MANDATE stalked inside, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole and raced at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the far turn, took the nod just past the eighth pole, dug in under steady handling through the lane but was caught in the final yards. HOT FUDGE SONDE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and dueled close inside the sixteenth pole, but was outfinished in the final yards. NOID rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole and contested the edge two deep on the far turn, was met just inside the eighth pole, remained close to mid-stretch but relented later yards. ALLEN CAN DO IT stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path then flattened stride. MONAASIB raced in the four path the first turn and settled close into the backstretch, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. SPUNMAN showed little response. RUN TO DAYLIGHT rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole then faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: C R's Mandate
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,chased 3/8,close rail turn,nod past1/8,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Noid
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead inside,pressured 3/8,edge turn,relented later yds

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc

ENTRY.NAME: With Secret Energy
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3p 1st turn,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,4p 1/8,up final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 14500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since December 27 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET ANNABELLA tapered in and stalked the early pace two deep, moved to even terms nearing the half mile pole and took the nod past the pole, dueled clear of Heidi T midway on the far turn, was steadily handled to widen then taken in hand later yards. MISS COREY raced hemmed in approaching the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and dueled through the stretch for second. AWESOME INCENTIVE saved ground on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. MIZZEN settled off the rail on the opening turn, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn, eased outward into the lane and finished evenly. GOLDEN SWEETS rounded the first turn about the four path, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. HEIDI T drew clear and angled to the inside to show the way early on, was met approaching the half mile pole, gave chase past the pole but dropped back at the rail midway on the far turn and weakened. PARTY MONSTER rated off the early pace inside, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened past the five sixteenths. DIXIE SUNRISE raced well off the pace in the three path of the opening turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Corey
ENTRY.COMMENT: hemmed in early,eased out 1/2,bid 3/8,3p far turn,dueled 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Mizzen
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 7/16,3p far turn,eased out 1/8,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Annabella
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,even terms 1/2,dueled clear mid turn,in hand late
